blog.name: why-i-love-comics
blog.title: A blog dedicated to all your favorite moments
blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

summary: I am Definitely Crazy.. Marvel Readings
title: I am Definitely Crazy.. Marvel Readings
body:
I am Definitely Crazy.. Marvel Readings

I have these moments where I get the urge to read all the works of a particular author, or all the retellings of a classic, book lists, etc. Happens all the time. Different things trigger it, like my love for Phantom of the Opera (I’m still working on those retellings). And now here I am planning on going down a very very long dark hole named MARVEL. Thanks a lot MCU movies.

I have dabbled…

View On WordPress

blog.description: Parody motivational fan made roleplay "ask blog" style for the fictional Marvel character Stephen Strange, the sassiest magician of the cosmos, NOT A DOCTOR. I DO NOT rp any innapropriate content with minors and I'll REPORT anyone I see doing so. No profit, just for fun. Follow me on Twitter @drstrangefanask

summary: You didn’t bring Mephisto to Earth...right? Because, Izzy...there’s no way I can stop him alone if he decides to destroy the...
body:
You didn’t bring Mephisto to Earth…right?
Because, Izzy…there’s no way I can stop him alone if he decides to destroy the world. I stopped him once but…a lot of people helped…

I’m not sure if I could do it.

reblog.comment:
You didn’t bring Mephisto to Earth…right?
Because, Izzy…there’s no way I can stop him alone if he decides to destroy the world. I stopped him once but…a lot of people helped…

I’m not sure if I could do it.

trail.content_raw:
You didn’t bring Mephisto to Earth…right?
Because, Izzy…there’s no way I can stop him alone if he decides to destroy the world. I stopped him once but…a lot of people helped…

I’m not sure if I could do it.
trail.content:
You didn’t bring Mephisto to Earth…right?
Because, Izzy…there’s no way I can stop him alone if he decides to destroy the world. I stopped him once but…a lot of people helped…

I’m not sure if I could do it.

summary: i owe you
body:
i owe you

w/c: 604

warnings: none

a/n: i was inspired by the extremely adorable pictures tom posted w the lost dog he found uwu

-

after searching up and down countless streets in your area while calling your dog‘s name out, you had practically lost hope in finding her.

she got loose from her leash during a walk and went chasing after a squirrel. typical, annoying, animal behavior. you couldn’t run as fast as her of course, so now she‘s gone. lost. worried would be an understatement for how you’re feeling.

you haven’t even gotten her chipped yet, so there’s no real way of finding her. any vets you try to call for advice have already closed for the day. it’s all a mess.

the walk back to your apartment with only a leash in hand is excruciating.

your head is hung low until you see her outside the door on the steps to the building. someone very cute, you think, that you don’t recognize has her in his arms.

perking up, you approach him. “hey! did you find her? how’d you know where to go?”

he holds her out to you with a wink. “saw her all alone while i was jogging, and her dog tag on the collar has your building’s address.”

you’d forgot about that.

you take her and scratch behind one of her ears. you’re starting to blush. the dog finding stranger leans against a railing.

“oh. right. i’m y/n, by the way. you have any pets?” you decide you don’t really want the conversation to end just yet.

“i’m tom. i’ve got a staffie called tessa back home. she’s never run away though,” he teases and hops up on the railing to sit.

tom.

you roll your eyes at tom while sitting on the step facing him, connecting your dog’s leash with the collar once again. she runs down the steps to bark at someone passing by, only this time, you have the leash wrapped tightly around your hand so you won’t lose grip.

“getting risky, huh?” now it’s tom’s turn to question you. a light chuckle escapes his lips as he glances off to the side.

you watch her. she gets bored of the empty street eventually and runs back up the steps with her tail wagging. she jumps up to his lap.

“she likes you,” you point out.

he picks her up to sit on him, his face lighting up.

“bet tessa would like you.”

you look up to see the two of them, but tom is already looking at you. your blush returns when he doesn’t look away.

“um…i never said thank you for finding my dog. and bringing her back. so, thank you. i really do appreciate it,” you manage to speak. your eyes are still staring into his.

“no worries at all, really.” he raises your dog’s paw up for emphasis, making you giggle to yourself.

“yeah, but i owe you for it. can i pay you?”

“nope.”

“then how can i owe you?” you stand.

“by going out on a date with me. only if you want to, though.” tom stands too, helping your dog back onto the ground as he does.

you swear you could feel your heart speeding up every second. how could someone you just met have this much of an effect on you?

“i want to.” you notice him hold back a smile.

after trading phone numbers and giving your dog one last pet, tom jokes that he better leave before tessa gets jealous.

he squeezes your shoulder gently and promises to text you. you promise to text him back. you wave goodbye as he walks down the steps and out of your sight.

you can’t wait to owe him.

reblog.comment:
i owe you

he picks her up to sit on him, his face lighting up.

“bet tessa would like you.”

you look up to see the two of them, but tom is already looking at you. your blush returns when he doesn’t look away.

“um…i never said thank you for finding my dog. and bringing her back. so, thank you. i really do appreciate it,” you manage to speak. your eyes are still staring into his.

“no worries at all, really.” he raises your dog’s paw up for emphasis, making you giggle to yourself.

“yeah, but i owe you for it. can i pay you?”

“nope.”

“then how can i owe you?” you stand.

“by going out on a date with me. only if you want to, though.” tom stands too, helping your dog back onto the ground as he does.

you swear you could feel your heart speeding up every second. how could someone you just met have this much of an effect on you?

“i want to.” you notice him hold back a smile.

after trading phone numbers and giving your dog one last pet, tom jokes that he better leave before tessa gets jealous.

he squeezes your shoulder gently and promises to text you. you promise to text him back. you wave goodbye as he walks down the steps and out of your sight.

you can’t wait to owe him.
